p:
The distortion arises from the existence of two groups of Eu-O distances: 2.240 and 3.000 Å (the first value is similar to the Eu-O distance in Eu 2O 3 and Eu 2Ti 2O 7, 2.2–2.3 Å). In principle, the lanthanide can also move in other directions. Off-center displacement of Eu 3+ along the crystallographic directions [110] (i.e. along a straight line parallel to the diagonal of the cube face) and [111] (towards a corner of the unit cell) will result in a reduction of the coordination number to 7 and 9, respectively. The local symmetry will be C
2v for displacement in the [110] direction and C
3v for displacement in the [111] direction.
